summary: This document appears to be email correspondence regarding the revision of a victim notification letter in the Epstein case. It involves a U.S. Attorney discussing phrasing that suggests Epstein has performed certain provisions, and it is now the government's turn to perform. The email chain includes a note about someone running off to 'grand July' (likely 'grand jury').

persons.name: Acosta, Alex
persons.context: Recipient and participant in email chain discussing revision of victim notification letter regarding Epstein's case.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Victim Notification
events.description: Email exchange regarding the revision of a victim notification letter in the Epstein case, with phrasing suggesting Epstein has performed certain provisions and it is now the government's turn to perform.

keyFacts: Email correspondence from June 26, 2008 discusses revising a victim notification letter in the Epstein case.
The phrasing suggests Epstein has performed certain provisions, and it is now the government's turn to perform.
The email chain includes a note about someone running off to 'grand July' (likely referring to grand jury proceedings).
U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta is involved in the correspondence regarding the victim notification.
